message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.KR, cs.CY, cs.DB 

The paper discusses the limitations of data-centric deep learning algorithms for non-transactional AI applications and proposes a solution through the creation of a knowledge repository for smart machines. This falls under the category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Machine Learning (cs.LG). The paper also mentions the use of evidential reasoning and causality reasoning, which are topics in Knowledge Representation and Reasoning (cs.KR). The proposed ReKopedia initiative involves building repositories of knowledge, which could also fall under the category of Databases (cs.DB). Finally, the paper discusses the importance of integrating knowledge from various parts of life, which could relate to the field of Cybernetics (cs.CY).
